Potential relationship between two m√©tiers targeting one species in a mixed fishery : 

\begin{equation}
E_{2,y} = \frac{c}{q_{1,2}B_{1,y}} - \frac{q_{1,1}}{q_{1,2}}E_{1,y} 
\end{equation}

Simplified Cobb-Douglas production function :

\begin{equation} 
C_{1,2,y} = q_{1,2}E_{2,y}B_{1,y}  
\end{equation}

Biomass can be expressed as :

\begin{equation}
 B_{1,y} = \frac{C_{1,2,y}}{q_{1,2}E_{2,y}} 
\end{equation}

We change the biomass term in the Eq 1 :
\begin{equation}
 E_{2,y} = \frac{c}{q_{1,2}\frac{ C_{1,2,y}}{q_{1,2}E_{2,y}}} - \frac{q_{1,1}}{q_{1,2}}E_{1,y} 
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
 E_{2,y} = \frac {c\space{}q_{1,2}E_{2,y}} {q_{1,2}C_{1,2,y}} - \frac{q_{1,1}}{q_{1,2}}E_{1,y} 
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
 E_{2,y} = \frac {c\space{}E_{2,y}} {C_{1,2,y}} - \frac{q_{1,1}}{q_{1,2}}E_{1,y} 
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
 \frac{q_{1,1}}{q_{1,2}}E_{1,y} = \frac {c\space{}E_{2,y}} {C_{1,2,y}} - E_{2,y} 
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
 \frac{q_{1,1}}{q_{1,2}}E_{1,y} = \frac {c\space{}E_{2,y} - E_{2,y}C_{1,2,y}} {C_{1,2,y}}  
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
 E_{1,y} = \frac{q_{1,2}}{q_{1,1}} \frac {c\space{}E_{2,y} - E_{2,y}C_{1,2,y}} {C_{1,2,y}}  
\end{equation}

\begin{equation}
 E_{1,y} =  \frac {E_{2,y}(c -C_{1,2,y})} {C_{1,2,y}}\frac{q_{1,2}}{q_{1,1}} 
\end{equation}

c is the total catch of species 1 : $$c = C_{1,1,y} + C_{1,2,y}$$

\begin{equation}
 E_{1,y} =  E_{2,y} \frac {C_{1,1,y}} {C_{1,2,y}}\frac{q_{1,2}}{q_{1,1}} 
\end{equation}
